--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "joehung302" <joe.hung@c...>
wrote:=

>
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> >
=
> > joehung302 wrote:
> > > This is a crawl that runs for about a week, col=
lected 14M links.
> > > Any ideas?
> > 
> > Crawl is still running, downloa=
ding?  Disks aren't filling up or 
> > reporting errors?
> 
> Crawler has p=
aused. 

I'm guessing because we OOME'd.

> I did a checkpoint and of cours=
e, failed.

What was the exception?


> The disk are not filling up. Howeve=
r, on this 1.8TB scsi array I did 
> see errors like this reported by the c=
rawler. 

This is a known issue
(http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?f=
unc=3Ddetail&aid=3D1218961&group_id=3D73833&atid=3D539099).
 Its been aroun=
d for a while.  Needs to be fixed.

> I have a bout 30 
> errors like this =
over the past week on this crawl and eventually I 
> got that Cursor closed=
 error then about 10 OOME after that.
> 

You think it because of the OOME?=
  Are they concurrent?


The bdbje folks commented:


"We're still in the m=
iddle of code reviewing, but we suspect that it's
a case of a masked except=
ion. Some problem occurred and an exception
was thrown, and the internal cu=
rsor was closed as part of the
exception handling. Then several layers up, =
another cursor close was
attempted, and a sanity check failed. Alas, the sa=
nity check masks the
original exception.

We're going to see if we can chan=
ge our code to prevent such masking,
and also to see if we can deduce what =
the original exception might
have been. In the meantime, I'll ask

    * Wa=
s this a transient problem? Did the crawl continue on? Is the
environment s=
till usable?
    * Are there any other exceptions anywhere else in your log=
? Any
chance a thread was interrupted?"


St.Ack
